pageProps.pageTitle: Get users by id list - Users | iTwin Platform

items.name: get-user
items.description:
Gets the metadata for the specified user id. This API will only return metadata for users that are in the same organization as the caller.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Rate limits

All iTwin Platform API operations have a rate limit. For more documentation on that visit [Rate limits and quotas](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/rate-limits/) page.

responses.description: This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
This response indicates that the specified user was not found.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: get-users
items.description:
Search for users by name or email. The search string is required and must be between 3 and 200 characters. Paging is not supported and it will not return more than 1000 users.

This API will only return metadata for users that are in the same organization as the caller.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Rate limits

All iTwin Platform API operations have a rate limit. For more documentation on that visit [Rate limits and quotas](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/rate-limits/) page.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: Find all users that have the search string anywhere in the name or email. Must be between 3 and 200 characters.

queryParameters.name: $search
queryParameters.description: Find all users that have the search string anywhere in the name or email. Must be between 3 and 200 characters.

responses.description: This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: get-users-by-id-list
items.description:
This API allows you to pass a list of user ids and get back the user metadata for each one. It is implemented as a POST so that the ids can be specified in the body instead of the url. This allows you to specify up to 1000 user ids.

This API will only return metadata for users that are in the same organization as the caller.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Rate limits

All iTwin Platform API operations have a rate limit. For more documentation on that visit [Rate limits and quotas](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/rate-limits/) page.

responses.description: This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.
